author: Akshay Patel
text: "Place is clearly overrated. Food quality was not so good
column5: not so bad either. If you have to wait more than an hour to get a sit
column6: it's clearly not worth it."

author: Tapan Acharya
text: "The food was good but I was shocked when my server came back demanding more tip. I went on 11/14 and had a bill of about $74 and paid $80. I don't like the culture of tipping especially for this reason. The menu price is all inclusive and everyone should always put in their best regardless of the tip amount. It was extremely rude of the waiter to come back to the table for more."

author: Cintya Andrea Ruz Ruz
text:
'(Translated by Google) Delicious

(Original)
Delicioso'

author: Joseph Carey
text: 'Couldn’t even get an order right. Would give zero if I could'

author: roberto islas
text: 'Great service beautiful view good coffee ☕️ lobster definitely not fresh an over cooked  I will give and other try on the future'

author: Steve Capo
text: 'Great food.    Server was OK
column5: not very friendly
column6: but they were busy.'

author: vrinda chopra
text: 'I loved this place. One of the best brunch places in Hoboken!!'

author: Deborah Markiw
text: 'Good service
column5: delicious food.  LARGE portions!'

author: N King
text: 'Beautiful view of NYC.  Friendly staff.  Pet friendly - they included providing a water bowl for my dog. Good prices. Quick
column5: efficient service. Breakfast was on point.'

author: kmason
text: 'Updated review:\n\nVisit with caution due to inconsistent customer service and care. Revised review: Down 2 stars from 5 stars to 3 stars. Called early this morning to make reservations for Sunday brunch for an important family get together. The restaurant told me that they don\'t take reservations so I needed to call in 20-30 minutes before arrival to get on the "wait-list". We followed instructions
column5: were ready to head out and called. We were told "...sorry
column6:
we don't have a wait list".

I asked to speak to a manager and was placed on the wait list that supposedly didn't exist. Upon arrival were were told we had to wait because they were busy. They finally seated us in a loft area with several tables crammed in a very small area. I was virtually shoulder to shoulder with an unknown person at the table next to us. Because there were so many people crammed into such a small area I asked to be relocated and was told they couldn't help me because they were too busy. I asked if they could put us back into the lineup and they said well ok but it would be a long time because they were too busy. So we left because we had a limited amount of time which is why we tried so hard to make a reservation in the first place. Sorry to say but we are not going back!
............
Below is my original review:

I recommend Turning Point of Hoboken. Breakfast
column7: brunch or lunch...kids
column9: groups...including vegan choices...all with a beautiful NYC view. One of our local favorites for over 6 years.'

author: Lillian Farhat
text: 'I ordered huevos rancheros and the casing on chicken sausage got stuck in my throat. It was terrible. Please be thorough in removing casing from sausage.'

author: Ryan Black
text: 'I thought the food was great and the menu was creative especially the seasonal menu. Coffee was also fantastic. Even a coffee ice cube so it didn’t get watered down! Oh it’s also very reasonably priced!'

author: rajkumar PARDASANI
text: 'Excellent food. Quality food. But too much of a wait. 45 min wait and 30 min to get your order.'

author: Diana PR
text: 'This is how I like my branch!  Delicious food
column5: friendly service
column6: clean and awesome atmosphere!'

author: Rai
text: 'Amazing choices! Lots of seasonal and local food!'

author: Alondra Hernandez
text: 'Went in for brunch with friends after it was highly reccomended. We all left super satisfied and happy. The portions
column5: prices and staff was just simply amazing. My new go to spot for breakfast.'

author: Angela Zhang
text: 'This place has become our go-to place in Hoboken. They have a great selection of food and drinks for brunch
column5: and not to mention their unparalleled view!'

author: Siddhant Jain
text: 'Great food
column5: Sweet and savory alike. Loved the shrimp hash and bacon lollipops'

author: Piush K
text: 'Awesome brunch any day during the week. Weekends usually have an average wait time of 30 minutes but its worth it. Also great views from window tables.'

author: Theresa Selamie
text: 'I lived in the area for 6 yrs.  Had no idea this gem of a place existed.  Highly recommend.'

author: Alex Bachinsky
text: 'Came here for breakfast and the food was super delicious. The view is beautiful Definitely will be back.'

author: Media Genesis Church
text: 'Came here for breakfast and the food was super delicious!! Definitely will be back.'

author: Casey Donohue
text: 'Update: I was mailed a voucher to try their salad again. I went today and it was back to the fresh fried chicken I’m used to having!\nI also ordered the lobster Benedict- which overall was fine
column5: but the lobster was questionable. It tasted off and had a weird crunch to it like it was just defrosted. Overall though
column6:
I think most people know that you probably should get seafood from anyplace other than a seafood place anyway.

I will be back again! (The last image is of today’s salad)

I’ve  been here multiple times and ordered the chop chop salad and loved it; finally treated myself today to it only to find dried up old chicken nuggets in my salad instead of fresh fried chicken like the last times.

Had I known they stopped making fresh food themselves - I would’ve bought my own bag of chicken nuggets myself… I mean really?! Come on!!! What a waste of money.

And they gave the me the wrong dressing.'

author: Michael Suessse
text: "Can't complain!! The food was excellent."

author: Del Von
text: 'Resturant by the sea'

author: Aaftaab T. Aahil
text: 'While vacationing in the area with family we searched around for a breakfast restaurant during our stay. After our second day in the area we came across this spot and we felt delighted. Not only we ordered the perfect breakfast all around but the waitress was also so good to us
column5: in fact she spoiled us with her tender and humble service. I believe she was of a Hispanic decent
column6: which reminded me of the people in Chile when I worked abroad. I told her
column7: we’re coming here for BK from now on
column8: and off course we would returned the next morning. Sure enough the next morning there we were walking through the door
column9: but that same waitress was not present that day so we got seated by a different waitress whom didn’t appear to care to even greet us. After we sat down I looked forward for a refreshing glass of water with lime in a pinch to start off with
column10: but instead it was served in individual glass
column11: no pitch and no lime. Meanwhile
column12: everyone else had a pitch off water with lime. That same person also took our order for the drinks
column13: yet when the kids got their drinks it was all wrong. Soon after we got another waitress
column14: I guess she was the one to take our food order. When the food came out my wife and I still had not coffee. I immediately told her that I can’t have BK without my coffee. After a king wait she finally brought it out but it was not the coffee we asked for. She was all over the place
column15: like a chicken without a head. Eventually when she got the coffee right I looked over and noticed my youngest son had no food yet so we waited and waited
column16: but soon decided to feed him from my plate. Actually
column17: four officers happened to be in the same room with us and couldn’t believe what was happening to us as they looked over
column18: in fact they expressed their sympathy for the bad service. The waitress wouldn’t even give us napkins. This service went from bad to terrible and one of worse service ever received. It was like fighting the enemy that I never once new
column19: while wearing a shirt that said “be kind.”This was so misleading! You have been warned! Review posted in good faith…'

author: Genese B
text: 'Food well seasoned
column5: and the view was amazing!'

author: Ambika Bansal
text: 'Delicious food and great service! My partner and I went to eat in Hoboken for the first time today and this place was awesome. NJ really gives you bang for your buck with their huge
column5: delicious portions. I had the combo with the egg white omelet with kale and power pancake
column6: and he ordered the huevos rancheros - would highly recommend them both. Come here hungry and ready to not spend a fortune!'

author: Isaiah Wilcox
text: 'BREAKFAST WAS amazing. Would highly recommend'

author: gurkan ayhan
text: 'The manager was so rude . Her name is Brenda. This is second time we having problems with her . She is acting like the boss she is talking with customers so bossy . I was really loyal customer of turning point it’s been 5 years but not anymore .'

author: Engin Onturk
text: 'I made a reservation for 4 people and 3 of us were able to make it however the manager (i think her name is Brenda) told us we can sit if all parties are here because otherwise she can’t give us the table.\n\nEven tough we told her that we will start ordering right away
column5: she gave us an attitude and turned our Sunday breakfast to a nightmare.\n\nIf it is to save tables for big parties
column6: it doesn’t make sense because on a rectangular table if 3 people can fit
column7: 4 people can definitely fit.\n\nVery unprofessional hospitality.. i would not come back here ever again..!!!'

author: Bob Mccracken
text: 'Great breakfast\nGreat views'

author: Alan Klayman
text: 'good
column5: but not as good as their other locations
column6: specifically Princeton
column7: Warrington
column8: and Long Branch.  but still very good'

author: Agreya Gandhi
text: 'The Eggs Benedict came without eggs\nOne drink ordered was missing'

author: Elena Nik
text: 'Waiting long time to be serve. Service not really fast. I ordered shaksuka
column5: which is not real shakshuka
column6: its version of mexican salsa with eggs. No tasty.very low quality.'

author: Tatiana Pumphrey
text: 'Love!!!'

author: LAYLA ASSEUM
text: 'Pancakes were good but the quality of the fruit on the French toast summer berry was not good.  Old bananas
column5: strawberry and blueberries. That poor quality fruit should not be served to the public. 👎'

author: Adam Zak
text: 'I placed an order for the waffle chicken with sriracha/honey glaze. I understand that there are shortages on certain foods at this time but
column5: it took 5 minutes for the waitress to come out and say that there was no chicken available. Instead I ordered a waffle with whipped butter and syrup as stated on the menu. No butter
column6: waffle was bland. Also ordered a side of bacon that costed 5$ for 2 strips. Disappointing  experience for a 20$ meal.'

author: Viz Ritz
text:
'July 11th 2021 @11:30 - 10 people

Food: 5 stars
Service: 1 star

Awesome food. Great view. Packed place after 9-10am. This is a great place for small group or couple breakfast/brunch place will get you table right away. Table for 10 had to wait 45mins+ wait even with online/virtual check-in. I was okay with the wait time cuz of the bigger group. Funny thing was that they were expecting 10 people to fit on table of 6
column5: no clue what they were thinking. One of my friend requested bigger table or asked to merge small table for 2. So at end 8 people sitting on table of 6 and another 2 people on merge table. But
column6: then after getting table 15-20 minutes no one came asking for orders  or start with drinks. After placing drinks order (coffee and tea only) we had to request them to get drink first until food get ready. Food was really good worth the wait time. We finally started eating around 12:15-12:30pm.\n\nOnce again this place is compact place. Group of 6-8 people or more has to wait definitely minimum 30minutes unless first group to walk-in when they open. So get there early as possible or before planned time. It just become little tricky with patience when an individual pass their brunch time and hunger becomes hard to controll.'

author: Amerika'da Bir Liseli
text: 'Pretty tasty brunch. It has a nice New York view and the prices are good.'

author: Chris Angell
text: 'A hidden gem
column5: with great food at reasonable prices.'

author: Karan Sethi
text: 'Quick service
column5: decent food and awesome views.'

author: Craig Heyne
text: 'Outstanding service.  The young lady who took care of us was so sweet and helpful.  The menu choices were difficult as everything had some uniqueness to it!  Coffee was strong and fresh.  I will go back often!'

author: milad abd el nour zaki
text: 'Nice place not good food'

author: Marianna Cesse
text:
'I was very disappointed today
First of all we were waited 30 min for a table which not an issue since it was a day right after holiday
The problem is after we got seated we waited for amour server about 10-15 min
We placed our order right away which included 2 coffees 2 OJs 2 milkshakes for the kids pancakes shakshuka sandwich with ham and fried eggs
No water was brought up to the table . We waited 15 min for our coffee just so you know I ordered regular coffee ( long story short I got with milk in it already instead of having it on a side ; I wasn’t even asked if I have any allergies or which milk I prefer )
column5: when I stopped our server and asked if I can at least have my coffee she said they still making it .It was another 5 min . After we finished all our drinks still no one offered water . We finally got our food which was COLD . All of it . And right after we got our check . Then 5 min later our server came to us because on the back they realized my child order was wrong ( to be fair she was nice ) which wasn’t a really big deal .After we finished our food I asked for containers which I got but not a bag . I asked hostess for a bag but she said I have to wait for our server and ask her even though she saw that we were ready to leave\nIn general place is nice with a really good view which I can’t really say about food also service was OK but definitely could be better\nI don’t think we are going to be back'

author: Jay Chua
text: 'Pretty good dining
column5: but the crowds makes the wait times quite long…'

author: Alireza khansari
text: 'Great view of New York'

author: Lou Garcia
text: "Food was good but the service was horrible. I waited 15 minutes & not one server even looked my way I wasn't even offered a glass of water. Had 2 wave somebody down 2 have a waiter come my way. I understand if it was noon but come on I got there @ 7:35 am & only 4 tables 2 wait on. What a disappointment."

author: Katrina Michalewski
text: "Super quick service
column5: incredible food. They get really busy so make sure you join their waitlist before you go. It's on their website!"

author: cristina marin
text: 'I would dare to rate it as the best brunch place in Hoboken!! A wide variety of coffee and many options to choose from for breakfast and lunch. Great place
column5: great service and amazing views of the city! How did I not try it before? An absolutely must for all Hobokenites! Everything’s tasty and delicious!'

author: alex serra
text: 'Small portions very expensive on the coffee and juice'

author: Beto Orihuela
text:
'(Translated by Google) Simply excellent!!!

(Original)
Simplemente excelente!!!'

text: '(Translated by Google) Excellent attention
column5:
good food.

(Original)
Excelente atención

author: Aki
text: "(Translated by Google) American shop. We visited the store with 5 people including children
column5: but there were sofa seats and we were able to eat slowly. The kids'menu was abundant
column6: and the French toast on the kids' menu was voluminous
column7: not to mention Macken cheese. Everything is delicious
column8:
but the number one was the shrimp bacon potato bowl! It was a fun shop to choose from a variety of Mexicans with soft-boiled eggs.

(Original)
アメリカンなお店。子ども含め5人で来店しましたがソファ席がありゆっくり食事ができました。キッズメニューも豊富、マッケンチーズはもちろん、キッズメニューのフレンチトーストはボリュームがありました。全部美味しいですが1番だったのはシュリンプベーコンポテトボウル！半熟卵も乗ってサイコー♡メキシカンも充実してて選ぶのが楽しいお店でした。"

author: Angelika Sharma
text: 'A long time go to for us
column5: super pleased to find they have expanded their menu to include "just eggs" and other healthier/allergy friendly options. We were extremely well taken care of on a busy Father\'s Day morning.'

author: Kevin Oleksowicz
text: 'Good if not in rush and having drinks was long wait for food that was halfway decent try go early before to busy no picture cause worth not worth showing the plating was rough'

author: Kimberly Beahm
text:
"Great creations on the menu.
I choose the bacon&grilled cheese with tortilla chips.
(I love real chips when they make them fresh!)
Was a nice atmosphere despite being so close to hustle&bustle. (I'm a small town gal at heart..felt good to slow down&enjoy my meal.) Great window views of the water
column5:
where an added bonus.
Very affordable for the area!
Entrance/bathrooms where nice&tidy as well.
Would recommend to friends."

author: Devin Santiago
text: 'Very disappointed with the service. I have eaten here in the past and have had wait time issues for the food. I decided to Uber eats my food this morning(no fault given to Uber for times) a simple skillet
column5: and a sandwich for myself and my wife. Not only did the food take an hour and 20 minutes to be completed
column6: but that meant my Uber driver sat there and waited as well.  Nearly 2 hours later from my initial ordering time
column7: the food arrives. I knew it would be cold
column8: but what I was not expecting was after waiting a 2 hour elapsed time for my food what would arrive was the wrong order. Luckily my wife’s food was correct but I received items I did not order. Terrible service

author: Amit Dutta
text: 'Great service
column5: great location for Sunday brunch!!'

text: 'Food is alright. Nothing special.'

text:
'This place is amazing!
The view of the city looks awesome.. !
Food. Is really good ! And the coffee ☕ is great they have a nice variety of coffee..
And servers are really friendly and attentive'

author: Lazaro Rodriguez
text: 'Food is OK nothing special
column5: what I didn’t like was some staff walking around with no mask on. If I learned anything from the pandemic people are germ filled beings and if you’re handling food you should not be breathing over my food I don’t want any type of bacteria on my food wear a mask!!!!!!!!'

text: 'Had to go very early and parking is tough to find.  Waiter was great and food was good.  Sat outside and the view of the city was amazing'

text:
'(Translated by Google) A restaurant overlooking Manhatan with a variety of dishes for breakfast and lunch. Very good service and delicious dishes.

(Original)
Un restaurant  con  vista a Manhatan con  variedad  de platos para el desayunar y almorzar. Muy buena atención y deliciosos platos.'

author: William Bicelis
text: '(Translated by Google) One of the places that made my trip to New York a dream. The food is incredibly good and the attention is impeccable. Love the place

column6:
cleanliness and decoration. 5/5

(Original)
Uno de los lugares que hice de mi viaje a New York un sueño. La comida es increíblemente buena y la atención es impecable. Ame el sitio

author: Samantha Meyers
text: 'Thank you for adding Just Egg and plant-based sausages!! 🌱 As someone who doesn’t always want eggs

column6: I was happy to find them on your Good For You section of your menu
column7: and for delivery too!\nLove their cold pressed juices too 😙👌'

author: Jen W
text: 'I read multiple reviews saying they forgot items in the order and gave them a try anyway. They forgot my smoothie order and when I called back they told me I would have to spend money to buy it again because GrubHub forgot it in the first place. Never again'

author: Reinhold Lmt.
text: 'I had the Shakahuka. It was a bit small
column5: but it was delicious.'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'we spent two hours there and we were so hungry
column5: because we had to wait so long for our server. waited thirty minutes for our drinks
column6: another twenty minutes for her to come and take our food order
column7: another thirty minutes for the food to come out.. other people who came after us got their food before we even ordered.. food was okay'

author: Alejandro S.
text: "It was really good
column5: food was good
column6: service was amazing
column7: the place is clean and we'll organized. Portions are big enough food is tasty and prices are decent. For a breakfast for 2 we paid 28 bucks in total.Thank you"

author: John Avanti
text: 'The views are amazing the food is ok. Good Pancakes. How can you mess up an omelet? Food could be allot better and served on hot plates. Coffee is good. The server was very slow to bring coffee and water. Very clean restaurant.'

author: X Boone (The FiG)
text: 'This place is sublime
column5: quiet
column6: and quaint. At first glance it will appear to be two separate brick and mortars but
column7: that because it is separated into different stores. One side for those patrons that adore the indoor dinning experience
column8: and then there is the café
column9: equipped to handle the demand of those "grab-n-go" custys. Appearance is clean and the atmosphere is peaceful coupled with the view of NY over the Hudson
column10: this is a great place to wind up before heading in to the bustling city
column11: or when prepping for a clairvoyant and progressive day on the clock.'

author: Christian Villacres
text: 'Food was amazing
column5: from the shareable pancakes and main meals. Service was really quick and efficient
column6: I appreciate that. Def will be coming back'

author: Sajud Hamza
text: 'Amazing place for a brunch !!service 5 star
column5: food 5 star
column6: ambience 5 star
column7: location 5 star...the place has the best view of new York from the jersey shore
column8: straight in front of the Empire State Building .. I have included the pictures of the menu too.. they have one of the best avocado toast
column9: you can also add some spice by adding Cajun spice with them..the best are the pancakes and waffles .I had the tropical crunch waffle which I loved to the core..and definitely you need a reservation If you don’t want to wait..walk ins are also there but you might have to wait for about 40 mins minimum for walk ins.. it’s a must try restaurant'

author: Divina C
text: "It was just ok for me...it wasn't worth the 2hour wait to be seated..Don't recommend. Overrated."

author: Ching-Ling Teng
text: 'Turning Point of Bryn Mawr. Worst experience ever.  Been sitting here for an hour and no food is served.  When inquired
column5: the waitress simply replied we are busy.  Thank you very much.'

author: Emily Barksdale
text: 'Turning point of Hoboken was amazing! Delicious food with a view. Quick service
column5: friendly staff
column6: and a cozy stylish restaurant all in one. Coffee was great too! Will definitely visit again when we are back in Hoboken!'

author: Ron Shaffery
text: 'Young staff
column5: need more experience to perform at a better level.  Menu could use updating.'

author: gürkan ayhan
text: 'The manager or who is taking reservations she was really rude . I been there many times I never get any problems the service and everything was amazing except today .'

author: Megan Flanary
text: 'Great service
column5: great food
column6: awesome views. Really clean and safe with Covid procedures too! Everything was spaced appropriately.\n\nI had a cold brew and it was so good! It even came with a “coffee cube” so that it wouldn’t get watered down 👍'

author: Ozzy Dugulubgov
text: 'Amazing food. Great views. Calm atmosphere. Loved the menu. One thing though
column5: when we came in the staff didn’t even say hi. We were staying by the entrance for some time without being seated. The place wasn’t busy at all.\nI had to ask them if we go choose a seat or someone will seat us. Only then they decided to give us a spot. But after that the waitress Victoria was very nice to us and helped us with menu.'

author: Ralf274
text: 'Great food and service. Perfect location.'

author: Xiaoxian Dong
text: 'Great food with reasonable price! There’re a lot of customers during weekend but the restaurant keep social distancing very well'

author: CRYSTAL LEITCH
text: 'My husband and I had a nice experience! We enjoyed the view and atmosphere. Everyone was friendly and attended to our needs in a timely manner. Food was very delicious and refreshing. We will definitely be visiting again!'

author: Dhruv Patel
text: 'Great quality food.\nWait timings are enormous
column5: but still
column6: worth it.'

author: Barry McGrorty
text: 'Excellent experience all around. Great view
column5: food
column6: and service. The waitstaff and managers really went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed ourselves.'

author: Jeanne Thomson
text: 'Cold food
column5: dry French toast
column6: so so service'

author: Isaiah Ellis
text:
"Came here for some breakfast and was very impressed. The view from inside let's you see the new york skyline which is always a fantastic view. The server was very friendly and provided quick service.

Had the Jamaican fresh press coffee which was delicious and provided 2 cups a piece for me and my gf.

Had the shrimp omelet which was huge! And very flavorful. The gf had the new york deli omelet and she loved it. I also got a belgian waffle and it was soft and had a nice crunch to it. Very good.

I can easily see us coming back."

author: I AM Elbaz
text: "I has beautiful Manhattan view from the east if the city
column5: especially mesmerizing at end of the day apx sunset times when the sun hits the city glass buildings.\nThe restaurant has big clean windows and very nice service.\nFood was average
column6: I had the Avocado Eggs Benedict
column7: the signature sauce didn't add any taste to the dish."

author: Pranit Kulkarni
text: 'Amazing vibe
column5: service
column6: food & location!\nMust visit for people who love brunch places.'

author: Tiffany Flores
text: 'This is my favorite brunch spot. The food is great and the view is awesome.'

author: Jazmin Rodriguez
text: 'Fast service
column5: very friendly staff
column6: seated right away. I usually go to the location in Westfield but took the drive for a different atmosphere since I love the food here. Food at this location was delicious as well as the other location & let’s not forget to mention the VIEW here! What’s not to love? Worth the drive.'

author: Mr. C
text: "This place is the absolute worst. No matter how many times I go there it's a very long wait just to pick up an order. Staff are always unprofessional never come to talk to you. They do not know the meaning of customer service. Just a bunch of immigrants and idiots. I will be avoiding this restaurant at all cost and I suggest you do the same cuz you will definitely be disappointed when you arrive at this store"

author: Hyungmin Mun
text: 'I had a great experience here. The wait time was not too bad (10min wait). The interior has a great view of NYC and most importantly clean! The staff were friendly and the food was quite delicious! I will be returning!\nThe onion the "benny" was a nice little touch! Haven\'t seen it done in other restaurants
column5: but it was good!'

author: DA M
text: 'Love it. High quality and great tasting!'

author: Amee Jogi
text: 'Best pancakes in Hoboken.'

author: Rob Chacon
text: 'awesome breakfast spot
column5: great view of the city. definitely recommend it!'

author: Breanne Crawford
text: "Do not underestimate this location - great Manhattan view and Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee will make your morning! I wasn't sure what I want so I got Health Freak Combo and couldn't be happier - savory egg white omelet and pancake - best of both worlds. Also
column5: service was so nice! Will definitely be back."

author: Margarita Alvarado
text: "Overall it is a pleasant
column5: quaint place with an amazing view over the Hudson River into NYC. I have been several times already and each visit has been pleasant. Food (Mainly breakfast is what i like to order) was delicious
column6: beverages I've tried (Nutty Irish Coffee
column7: Heavenly S'mores Hot Chocolate
column8: etc.) Hit the spot. Cant wait for warmer weather and actually try out their outdoor seating that has been set up during the Pandemic)"

author: Kevin Whitaker
text: "My favorite spot in the neighborhood
column5: mainly for the ambience but also for the food. Some of the coffee drinks are hit or miss but the vanilla chai is one of my favorites anywhere
column6: and all the brunch food I've tried is good-to-great."

author: Ash
text: 'There is something fundamentally wrong with Turning point’s business philosophy and conduct - we have never encountered anything like this in Hoboken.\n\nWe put the order in on Turning point website
column5: paid service fee
column6: delivery fee and tip
column7: and we got the wrong delivery.  Upon calling Turning Point
column8: the woman who identified herself as manager said they have no responsibility for this issue and that the driver is at fault for taking the wrong package.  They asked us to re-order or pick up
column9: and that they cannot refund us any of the service or delivery fees
column10:
nor help track what went wrong.  What surprises us about this is two things:

1. Turning point takes no responsibility for the use of a delivery partner to execute their business.  They feel no need to review their partner or take any corrective actions.  They completely wash their hands of this business decision.

2.  Turning point feels no need to apologize to their customer.  The manager told us they have no part in this issue and it is solely with the delivery partner.  They have no need to take any corrective actions such as making sure the packages are labeled correctly and minimizes delivery error.

3. When we asked for compensation for the frustration we have been through
column11: and their attitude towards 1 and 2 above
column12: they said they cannot give any refund beyond the food total and that we are welcome to leave a review.'

author: Jessica Cabrera
text:
'(Translated by Google) Delicious Huevos Rancheros

(Original)
Delicioso los huevos rancheros'

author: Mike Nong
text: 'I arrived with the Yelp showing only 1 people ahead
column5: but after waiting for 25 mins
column6: the waiter told me there still 3 people ahead of me. So I had to leave
column7: wasting $17 of the parking fees. Not recommend.'

author: Anuja Puranik
text: 'This is my fav brunch place in Hoboken. The food is great along with amazing skyline views. In pandemic
column5: they are taking good precautions with cleanliness and sanitization. Very quick service and staff is friendly. We ordered avocado toast- which was Okish..but they have great coffee / tea choices. I ordered vanilla chai tea latte and it was very good. They have good selection of pancakes - lemon blueberry is the best one . We also ordered zucchini bowl which is a very healthy option. Definitely recommend this place.'

author: Sneh Shah
text: 'This has to be my most favorite breakfast place around hoboken and Jersey city.\n\nCoffee is great
column5: food is great
column6: service is good and the ambiance.\n\nThey are also following good covid restrictions like all the servers has masks on
column7: tables are at a good distance.\n\nNever a bad experience.'

author: Jamaal Williams
text: 'Good food
column5: great view'

author: Jonathan Murphy
text: "Best turning point of them all
column5: crazy good food
column6: wouldn't order takeout or delivery bc of food temperature once it is time to indulge
column7: so worth the time to sit down and enjoy an amazing breakfast or brunch."

author: stephanie villafranca
text: 'This place never ever disappoints. Especially during the pandemic
column5: they go OUT OF THEIR WAY
column6: To make you feel safe. It is incredibly clean. They offer plastic utensils
column7: the food is so good and the servers are just so incredibly nice. This is why I will come here again and again and continue to support them even with takeout.'

author: WILLIAM AVAL
text: 'The food was so good

author: Mark Schwartz
text: 'Great food. The view is amazing.'

author: Alexander Brathwaite

author: Ekaterina Tashina
text: 'If I could provide 1/3 star I would! Disgusting! Me and my boyfriend ordered delivery food and unfortunately received not-fresh disgusting things!  They forgot to cook all vegetables that weren’t fresh at all. The potato in my food was at least cooked yesterday or even before!! The cheese and eggs smelled really bad! If you don’t wanna poison yourself don’t order food from this place!'

author: Camila Cardona
text: 'We did walk in and waited 40 minutes for a table and we were offered a inside table and accepted we observed there were plenty of booths available by the windows but they decided to put us in a corner table far away from the windows when I asked if there was a possibility to be seated by the window they said no because it was only for large parties so we said we understood and 3 minutes later they walked in with 2 people just like us and sat them in the seats a requested. We also observed that all the people on the side we were on were Hispanic as well as us while all the people by the window were white Americans but the food was really good and the server was nice polite ha was excellent I would like to be treated equally and have the same privileges as everyone else in the restaurant also a tip on the omg french toast put more of the white creamy stuff and maybe put it on the side since it melted before they could put it on the table.'

author: O K
text: 'Excellent place to have a brunch with the City View'

author: Jim Barrett
text: 'Just ordered a salad.  It was made from ingredients which were no longer fresh. Lettuce was limp.  Red peppers were of  a reddish squash consistency. Cucumbers were discolored and going bad. Uck!'

author: Nikhil Gandhi
text: 'Extremely accommodating for a group of 9 during peak brunch time and BYOB friendly (with the exception of hard liquor)'

author: Joseph Pratt
text: 'The staff was very attentive and the food was excellent'

author: Kornelia Jablonska
text: 'The food was great! The view is just breath taking...definitely will revisit soon. The food came out quick. Good prices for its location. And also my waiter was very nice.'

author: Monika S.
text: 'The turning point was one of my favorite brunch spots at a different location in south jersey. Unfortunately
column5: I will never come back to this place. The manager/hostess (Maria?) was extremely disrespectful and nasty
column6: and after a two hour wait I tried to explain to her that my family was walking and would be here within the next 5 minutes
column7: they got lost and I told her I’d be willing to start ordering my food now
column8: but she said they had 4 minutes or she was giving my table away. As I was sitting down she told me I need to get up NOW (although I waited over 2 hours for this table) and dragged the chairs from underneath the table as I was sitting there with another person from my party. Terrible customer service
column9: and just a major lack of humanity
column10: especially considering she claimed she was the “supervisor” AND “manager” (I believe Maria was her name) and when I asked to speak to her boss she said she was the only person in charge (shocking); but thankfully due to her rudeness & unwillingness to be accommodating I found an amazing spot up the street that welcomed my entire family so politely
column11: the Hudson Tavern... I highly recommend!'

author: Sarthak Brahma
text: "Vegans should ignore this place - nothing besides vegan pancakes and the bland avocado toast. Not much to say about the taste
column5: service
column6: or the watered down black coffee. The location is good and convenient and that's pretty much all that can be said objectively on the positive side."

author: Nancy Aybar
text: 'Food was delicious'

author: Kyle Gehan
text: 'Good food

author: Chris H

author: Adonis Garcia
text: "Great food
column5: long wait
column6: manager was very rude and disrespectful my family was visiting from Connecticut and were traveling with a service dog
column7: after an hour & 45 minute wait
column8: manager tells me the tables is available inside how ever dog are not allowed inside I explained the dog was a service dog and provided the service dog letter that was provided to me
column9: she stated unless we have a service dog card we cannot be seated inside unfortunately in state of Connecticut a card isn't issued
column10: she then stated we could split and sit 5 inside & 5 outside we respectfully declined as we wanted to have brunch as a family
column11: later on she said to wait an extra 45 minutes and she could possibly seat us outside. With the dog
column12: servers were nice but services wasn't the greatest
column13: they wouldn't clean off tables nor ask how everything was going..... would I come again ? Absolutely not. Manager so have better customer service skills or be more accommodating to your guest."

author: Mari Esco
text: "I've always been a fan of the Turning Point. I usually visit the Long Branch location over the summer.  I live in Bloomfield
column5: NJ and it was brought to my attention that they have a Hoboken location. To my excitement
column6: I was looking forward to visiting the Hoboken location to enjoy my go to Martha vineyard salad.\nI was disappointed!! My mixed greens were old and discolored! I've never been disappointed with the Long Branch location! Hoboken location please take more pride in what you serve your customers."

text: 'Food was good but service needs to be better.'

author: Sophia T

author: Ralph Basile
text: 'It seems like they need a little bit more organization pertaining to their takeout orders. There was no social distancing in that little Hall where you pick up your food and the wait was too long'

author: Mary Soliman
text: 'I frequent at this establishment at least once a week because the food is delicious and the servers are kind. With that being said
column5: as a patron I put at least 80 dollars a week towards this place. Today I placed an order over the phone and notified the host that my husband will come and pick up the order. Moments later while I’m on the phone with my husband I hear how my husband is treated at this establishment. Hosts rudely push him to the side
column6: place other orders over him
column7: ask him to grab a drink for another customer
column8: and lastly give him a hard time to check for a drink I order all the time which was missing from the bag. The difference between me and my husband is purely complexion. Why are our experiences completely different? It’s a breakfast place! You expect him to go on the rest of his day with that horrible experience! I later call for the manager it seems a host picks up and says
column9: yes the he is here. Same host answers and says yes I’m the manager
column10: Maria. Same woman who made my husband wait hours for the bag that was already ready was recorded to be there since he arrived. How dare you guys do that?! We both serve as well and know how crazy the wait times can be but we also know when hostesses or servers play manager. I had no intention of writing a review because it is not my style but because the host refused to let me speak to a manager to sort this out
column11: I go public. Not cool and no
column12: we will not be dining here again.'

author: Kyle Englishman
text: 'Great service. The food was really good and prices were reasonable. The turkey chili is quite good.'

author: gc nj
text: 'Amazing  place   with  employee care  ....'

author: Juan Huerta
text: "I've been coming to this place with my family and I have to say. Service is excellent. Good quality food. Beautiful and clean place. I always looks at 3 things everywhere I eat. If the place is clean

author: Carol Benitez
text: "I have been going to this place for years

author: Matthew D'Ambrosio
text: "OMG!! THE BEST BREAKFAST/ BRUNCH PLACE !! Ever since this quarantine me and my partner have been ordering alot. No one can compete with this place IHOP has nothing on them .I have been ordering almost every morning lol. I am just so  satisfied everytime we get it .I can't wait to actually go there and dine in when this Quarantine is over ....thank you  Matthew D. JournalSquare J.C"

author: Ginette B
text: "This place is great. I love the food and atmosphere. Hudson views and natural lighting. The staff is friendly and show respect to the customers. The hot chocolate is from syrup so it's too sweet for me

text: 'We picked a beautiful Sunday to have brunch in Hoboken!! First time at Turning Point and overall it was a great experience... wait was ridiculously long but to put in perspective... it took us just as long to find parking.. when they tell you 60 to 75 minutes

author: Tyler Lipshutz
text: "Go to Turning Point. period. stop reading and just go. wait however long it takes. just go. you'll never find a better breakfast spot that literally has flights of juices you and all your friends will LOVE. There is something for EVERYONE at Turning Point."

author: Edward Curtis
text: 'I have eaten at the Hoboken location approximately 40 times in the past few years. Not because the food is great or the service is good. Frankly the place smells and the staff is inexperienced. The only reason anyone does eat there is because it’s one of the few places in the area open at that time. Today was the last straw. I was rushing to catch the ferry and I needed to use the restroom. I was literally in the restroom 40 seconds when the counter girl told me I couldn’t use the restroom “as per the Manager”. I have never used the restroom there the many times I’ve been there before. I bought a coffee to make up for using the restroom
column5: because “ I was  not a customer” . I’ve been a customer for many years but I will never go back. Has anyone there ever heard of kindness
column6: courtesy or compassion? If any of their staff ever came to my place of business I would graciously offer them the use of our facilities. With a smile. Happy Holidays'

text: 'Very nice by the water....staff was very warm'

Horrible attitude towards her customers. If she was busy she could have just said so politely it wouldn\'t have been an issue. Won\'t be returning after that experience.'

text: "Food is good

She was great. Def going back!!!'

author: Love & Light Lisa Chiara
text: 'Made a rainy Mother’s Day

column6: for a great time.  The food is so delicious
column7: the presentation appealing.  I truly enjoyed my Wilbur Skillet and Kona coffee.  Will return again soon! Must try if you are in Hoboken. Delicious breakfasts!!!'

author: Brian Lopez
text: 'The food was ok. It was eggs
column5: potatoes
column6: and cheese were dry. The waiter kept getting our orders wrong too. The inside of the restaurant was nice tho.'

author: Adams Journey
text:
'A group of 5 of us went here on a Sunday for Breakfast.

I would recommend that you go on the website and use their booking service because the place is absolutely packed. Even having booked we had to wait another 30 minutes past our time.

But don’t let that put you off. It’s right on the river front and we had a booth next to the window with the views of Manhattan. Perfect.

The choice of food for breakfast was enormous. In the end I opted for the Huevos Rancheros. (See Pic)
To go with that I had French Vanilla coffee.

Not only was it all delicious but reasonably priced too. Service was great.

I’ll definitely go back. Maybe for lunch next time.'

author: Kareem I. Talaat
text: 'Coffee was great'

author: Parth Soni
text: "Decent brunch food. The french press coffee's are very good!"

author: Kerry Althea
text: 'Best breakfast and brunch spot'

author: Sayali Upasani
text:
"If you want nice food.. lively ambience and amazing view..this is your place!
I have visited this place often and I loved their omlettes (I personally don't eat meat but heard it's good too).
You must try their French press coffee!
Remember: they do have long waiting times!"

text: 'Place is packed in the weekend  they all come for the good food of course'

author: Frank Witzke
text: '(Translated by Google) A must for a delicious breakfast in Hoboken. A very extensive selection and great views of NYC over the Hudson round off the great impression. We have been there several times
column5: have tried different things
column6:
everything was delicious and the service was always very friendly.

(Original)
Ein Muss für ein leckeres Frühstück in Hoboken. Eine sehr umfangreiche Auswahl und tolle Ausblicke auf NYC über den Hudson hinweg runden den tollen Eindruck ab. Wir waren mehrfach dort
column7: haben unterschiedliche Dinge probiert
column8: alles war sehr lecker und der Service war stets sehr freundlich.'

author: Joe Hicks
text: 'The only thing good about this place is the view. Otherwise
column5: it is managed mediocrely. And the food is mediocre. Jose was a good server
column6: though.'

author: Pack My Bag Please
text:
'Awesome Sunday Brunch with a view!
FOOD- We had the Pesto infused skillet scrambled eggs & home-style Huevos Rancheros & totally loved it. Their in-house organic coffee blend is just perfect!

AMBIENCE- Great NYC skyline views & nice decor.

SERVICE- Good
column5: orders usually take some time due to crowded weekends.'
